body: So is the file resurrected on `pie` or what? The path is just what you've shown, no directories anywhere?

Files on pie are fine.  No directories - copy and paste from gui.

```
root@pie:/mnt/stik1/st/phhg# ls reca*
recaptchalib.php  recaptchalib.php.new
root@pie:/mnt/stik1/st/phhg# cd .st
.stfolder/   .stversions/ 
root@pie:/mnt/stik1/st/phhg# cd .stversions/
root@pie:/mnt/stik1/st/phhg/.stversions# ls reca*
recaotchalib.php.new
```
Just a guess, but it might have something to do with the "deleted" version having the same name as the  main one.

The only thing wrong I've seen is the extra line in the recent changes list on pie (remote server).
What type of device is pie, rasberry? Which of the devices is pie? 2?

```
dev1     laptop             pc                     moncerus            T23BC6D
dev2     local server      raspberry pi 1          pi                  3YBZSGE
dev3     remote server     raspberry pi zero w     pie                 B3IQ5IL
```
So pie is dev3.

dev1 <--> dev2 <--> dev3

I suspect it's some sort of time skew on a device with questionable capabilities.

I think the third device (device 1) is sort of irrelevant here, are you able to repro with 2 devices?

I agree that dev 1 is irrelevant.  It was, however, a real-world example and not contrived.

As to time skew, I don't agree.  OK, the pis don't have an rtc   After a reboot, the time is slow until synchronised with a time server when it adjusts by about half a minute.  The cron entry to start the syncthing service starts with sleep 60.

Internet-connected pis keep good time except immediately after boot when they start at the time saved at shutdown.

OK, I'll give it a go.

Preparing to do a test as requested, I found out that the problem doesn't just arise for deletes, it happens with modifies too.  I stripped trailing whitespace.

dev1
monocerus | modified | file | recaptchalib.php.new | 2018-03-20 21:01:25

dev2
monocerus | modified | file | recaptchalib.php.new | 2018-03-20 21:01:38

dev3
pie | added | file | recaptchalib.php.new | 2018-03-20 21:01:42
T23BC6D | modified | file | recaptchalib.php.new | 2018-03-20 21:01:40

root@pie:/mnt/stik1/st/phhg# ls -l recapt*
-rw-r--r-- 1 david david 9910 Feb 10  2014 recaptchalib.php
-rw-r--r-- 1 david david 9869 Mar 20 21:01 recaptchalib.php.new
root@pie:/mnt/stik1/st/phhg# ls -l .stversions/recapt*
-rw-r--r-- 1 david david 10133 Mar 20 21:01 .stversions/recaptchalib.php.new
root@pie:/mnt/stik1/st/phhg#

Test with just dev2 (pi) and dev3 (pie)

```
david@pi:/mnt/u/st/phhg$ date;ls -l testfile
Tue 20 Mar 23:13:56 GMT 2018
ls: cannot access 'testfile': No such file or directory
david@pi:/mnt/u/st/phhg$ date;touch testfile
Tue 20 Mar 23:14:34 GMT 2018
david@pi:/mnt/u/st/phhg$ date;ls -l testfile
Tue 20 Mar 23:14:39 GMT 2018
-rw-r--r-- 1 david david 0 Mar 20 23:14 testfile
david@pi:/mnt/u/st/phhg$ date;nano testfile
Tue 20 Mar 23:15:40 GMT 2018
david@pi:/mnt/u/st/phhg$ date;nano testfile
Tue 20 Mar 23:18:28 GMT 2018
david@pi:/mnt/u/st/phhg$ date;nano testfile
Tue 20 Mar 23:20:01 GMT 2018
david@pi:/mnt/u/st/phhg$ date;rm testfile
Tue 20 Mar 23:22:14 GMT 2018
david@pi:/mnt/u/st/phhg$ 
```

```
david@pie:/mnt/stik1/st/phhg$ ls -l testfile
ls: cannot access 'testfile': No such file or directory
david@pie:/mnt/stik1/st/phhg$ ls -l .stversions/testfile
-rw-r--r-- 1 david david 21 Mar 20 23:22 .stversions/testfile
david@pie:/mnt/stik1/st/phhg$ cat .stversions/testfile
line 1
line 2
line 3
david@pie:/mnt/stik1/st/phhg$
```
Note that the actions by pie on its recent changes list should not be there, but there is no other ill effect.
Thanks, I'll try to look into it at some point.

I've tried it the other way round.

**pie**
```
david@pie:/mnt/stik1/st/ddocs$ ls -la
total 20
drwxr-sr-x  4 david david 4096 Jan  3 13:45 .
drwxrwsr-x 15 david david 4096 Nov 13 10:05 ..

total 0
david@pie:/mnt/stik1/st/ddocs$ ls /mnt/data/stvers/ddocs
current HHGmembership.docx  My PaperPort Documents      Scans

line 1back
line 2back

david@pie:/mnt/stik1/st/ddocs$ date;rm testback
Wed 21 Mar 12:10:44 GMT 2018
david@pie:/mnt/stik1/st/ddocs$ ls -l testback
ls: cannot access 'testback': No such file or directory
david@pie:/mnt/stik1/st/ddocs$ ls -l .stversions/testback
ls: cannot access '.stversions/testback': No such file or directory
```

**pi**
```
david@pi:~$ cd /mnt/u/st/ddocs
david@pi:/mnt/u/st/ddocs$ ls -l testback*
-rw-r--r-- 1 david david 23 Mar 21 12:08 testback
david@pi:/mnt/u/st/ddocs$ ls -l testback*
ls: cannot access 'testback*': No such file or directory
david@pi:/mnt/u/st/ddocs$ ls -l .stversions/testback*
-rw-r--r-- 1 david david 12 Mar 21 12:05 .stversions/testback~20180321-120538
-rw-r--r-- 1 david david 23 Mar 21 12:08 .stversions/testback~20180321-120859
david@pi:/mnt/u/st/ddocs$ 
```

**pie**
```
Device | Action | Type | Path | Time
-- | -- | -- | -- | --
pie | deleted | file | testback | 2018-03-21 12:16:55
pie | modified | file | testback | 2018-03-21 12:09:43
pie | added | file | testback | 2018-03-21 12:05:52
```

**pi**
```
Device | Action | Type | Path | Time
-- | -- | -- | -- | --
pi | added | file | testback~20180321-120859 | 2018-03-21 12:18:00
pie | deleted | file | testback | 2018-03-21 12:16:57
pi | added | file | testback~20180321-120538 | 2018-03-21 12:10:59
pie | modified | file | testback | 2018-03-21 12:09:59
pie | added | file | testback | 2018-03-21 12:06:08
```
The intention was to show all was ok the other way round, but it isn't
.
There's a rescan on pi between 12:10:59 and 12:16:57.

And we have two versions created.

So, there's a problem this way round too.
xxxxxxxxxxxx
So I can't reproduce it between my windows and linux machines on master.

Right, I know what this is.

You have your .stversions directory added as and unshared folder, probably for the purpose of block reuse from .stversions.

Global change log is a bit shit as it doesn't tell you which folder the change happened in, just the filename, and you are getting confused as to where the change is coming from.

rename.from: Spurious added action in recent changes list with trash can versioning
rename.to: Global change log does indicate folder

body:
> You have your .stversions directory added as and unshared folder, probably for the purpose of block reuse from .stversions.

Spot on.

There are 13 main folders and for each of these the .stversions directory is an unshared folder for the reason you give.

rename.from: Global change log does indicate folder
rename.to: Global change log should indicate folder
